description: From Middle English outliven, equivalent to out- +â€Ž live.

verbs.description: outlive (third-person singular simple present outlives, present participle outliving, simple past and past participle outlived)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To live longer than; continue to live after the death of; overlive; survive.
examples: And he that calls on thee, let him bring forth / Eternal numbers to outlive long date.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To live through or past (a given time).
examples: This must have been the way mamma had first looked at Sir Claude; it brought back the lustre of the time they had outlived.

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To live longer; continue to live.
